results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.

results.title: Communicating change
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Australia Post and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program examines the issues of managing change in the workplace. It shows the importance for everyone in the workplace to understand what changes are going to happen, why they are happening and how everyone will be affected by them.

results.title: Family Court
results.creator_credit: Peter Campbell, Diane Sundin, Family Court of Australia and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 58 of Series “English at work”.
This video explains the role of the Family Court in divorce cases. It explains the grounds for applying for divorce, and the issues involved in a divorce in Australia. It also explains options offered by the Family Court after an application for divorce has been made: the structure of Information sessions, conciliation conferences, and court counsellors to help resolve differences in the main areas of dispute; children and property.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Campbell, Diane Sundin, Family Court of Australia and SBS-TV

results.title: Elements of surface hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is pack and gas carburised; how a thin, hard case is obtained by cyaniding; how nitriding is used to obtain a very hard case; and how steel is flame and induction hardened.

results.title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.

results.title: Elements of hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, United States. Federal Security Agency, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is quench-hardened; how the structures and hardness of steels with different carbon content change at progressive quench-hardening stages; how an iron-carbon diagram is constructed and what information may be derived from an analysis of such a diagram.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, United States. Federal Security Agency, United States. Office of Education and Audio Productions

results.title: Selection of dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”

Introduces the principles which govern the choice of dimensions. These principles are shown to be based on two factors: (1) the functional characteristics of the object, which includes consideration of the accuracy demanded and the relation of the portion to other elements of the unit or machine; and (2) the manufacturing methods used in making the object.
